summary: "A fork of the Corebird GTK Twitter client that continues to work with Twitter"
notice: Perfect since release 1.3.1

name: Decoder
summary: "Scan and Generate QR Codes"
notice: Camera does not work yet, app appears to be using Xwayland, meaning it is a bit blurry.

name: Health
summary: "A health tracking app for the GNOME desktop."
notice: Only supports Google Fit – therefore the rating is based on the setup dialog

name: Mt
summary: "A terminal written in Rust and gtk-rs"

name: Dino
summary: "Modern XMPP ("Jabber") Chat Client using GTK+/Vala"
notice: The rating is only for the feature/handy branch

name: Cuttlefish
summary: "GNOME PeerTube client"
notice: It’s very much WIP and does not really work well yet.

name: Lord Almighty’s Modern Bible (LAMB)
summary: "Lord Almighty's Modern Bible (LAMB) is a cross platform Bible application. It was designed with mobile in mind and provides an offline copy of the Bible in an elegant look and feel."
notice: Works great!

name: Media Server Connect (MSC)
summary: "Media Server Connect is a simple web app for connecting to the web interface of an Emby server."

name: Home Assistant Connect (HAC)
summary: "HA Connect is a simple web app for connecting to the web interface of an Home Assistant server. "

name: ABV Calculator
summary: "ABV Calculator is a refractometer ABV calculator intended for beer or wine"

name: Pikasso
summary: "Simple drawing programs using Kirigami for the UI and Rust for the rendering."

name: Kairo
summary: "Programmable timer"

name: Qwertone
summary: "Turns your PC into music instrument"
notice: Scales well, but needs the virtual keyboard to make sounds because it’s not really made for touchscreens.

name: Castor
summary: "A graphical client for plain-text protocols written in Rust with GTK. It currently supports the Gemini, Gopher and Finger protocols."
notice: Works!

name: Master Key
summary: "Master Key is a password manager application built with Python 3 and GTK that generates and manages passwords without the need to store them."

name: GPodder Adaptive
summary: A mobile friendly adaption of the GPodder GTK UI
notice: Now a branch of the main project, scaling just fine.

name: PassUi
summary: "PassUi is a free and open source graphical user interface for the standard unix password manager written in python, with small screens in mind."

name: caerbannog
summary: "Frontend for password-store"

name: pass-manager-compact
summary: "Compact GUI for pass to be useable for smartphones"
notice: #helpwanted, testing needed

name: Weather Mobile
summary: "A simple GTK weather app to play with Linux Mobile development in GTK4 and OpenWeather API."
notice: WIP, lacks desktop file and PKGBUILD does not work.

name: Notejot
summary: "Stupidly-simple notes app."
notice: Slightly too wide (15px maybe) without scale-to-fit.

name: Spot
summary: "Native Spotify client for the Gnome desktop"
notice: Spotify Premium only

name: eOVPN
summary: "OpenVPN Configuration Manager"
notice: scale-to-fit helps with properly scaling the settings menu to make it usable

name: Crow Translate
summary: "A simple and lightweight translator that allows to translate and speak text using Google, Yandex and Bing."

name: siglo
summary: "GTK app to sync InfiniTime watch with PinePhone"
notice: Great companion app for updating and time syncing InifiniTime, e.g. on the PineTime smartwatch.

name: Idok Remote
summary: "A simple Kodi remote that supports multiple Kodi instances.”

name: Wordbook
summary: ”Wordbook is a dictionary application made for Linux using Python and GTK 3.”

name: AudioTube
summary: "Client for YouTube Music"
description: "AudioTube can search YouTube Music, list albums and artists, play automatically generated playlists, albums and allows to put your own playlist together."

name: Elisa
summary: "Beautiful no-nonsense music player with online radio support"
description: "A simple music player that should be easy to use. It does not require any configuration before one can use it."

name: Sound Recorder
summary: "A simple and modern sound recorder"

name: wake-mobile
summary: "Proof-of-concept alarm app that uses systemd timers to wake up the system"
notice: Just really simple, working Proof-of-Concept, easy to make install and uninstall

name: Numberstation
summary: "A Gnome Authenticator clone."
description: "A Gnome Authenticator clone. A Gnome Authenticator clone. This generates 2fa tokens based on secrets installed. It registers as uri-handler for otpauth:// urls so they can be added from Megapixels."

name: Thumbdrives
summary: "Thumbdrive and ISO emulator for phones"

name: Sums
summary: "A postfix calculator"
description: "Sums is a simple GTK postfix calculator that adheres to GNOME's human-interface guidelines. It is designed to be keyboard-driven and aims to feel natural to interact with by recognising English-language input as mathematical constants and operations."

name: Characters
summary: "Character map application"
description: "Characters is a simple utility application to find and insert unusual characters.  It allows you to quickly find the character you are looking for by searching for keywords."
notice: Rating applies to version 40, previous releases may not work well.

name: Mousai
summary: "Simple application for identifying songs"

name: Tubefeeder
summary: "A Youtube-Client made for the Pinephone"
notice: Make sure to read https://github.com/Schmiddiii/Tubefeeder/wiki

name: postmarketOS tweaks
summary: "Application for exposing extra settings easily on mobile platforms"

name: Public Transport
summary: "Bring Real time information for public transportation (currently in Germany) to Linux phones/the Linux desktop"
description: "Bring Real time information for public transportation (currently in Germany) to Linux phones/the Linux desktop (the basic features of the likes of DB Navigator or Transportr)."
notice: Rust app, it is planned to publish the app on flathub in the future

name: Simple Diary
summary: "Simple and lightweight diary app."

name: Pamac
summary: "Graphical Package Manager for Manjaro Linux with Alpm, AUR, Appstream, Flatpak and Snap support"

name: Telegrand
summary: "A GTK4 telegram client built to be well integrated with the GNOME desktop environment."
notice: WIP, far from feature complete but works using own API key.

name: Lith
summary: "Multiplatform WeeChat relay client"
description: "Lith is a multiplatform WeeChat Relay client, allowing you to connect to your running WeeChat instance from anywhere, be it your phone or your desktop computer."
notice: WeeChat client – you will need to set up and configure WeeChat to use this.

name: Khronos
summary: "Track each task's time in a simple inobtrusive way"
notice: Sadly deep sleep interferes with time tracking on the PinePhone, but other than that: Nice app!

name: PineBattery
summary: "GTK app for monitoring the PinePhone and PineTab battery."
notice: Cloning the repo and running install.sh is enough to try this simple battery monitor.

name: Birdie
summary: "Wakeup Alarm App for a Linux Phone"
notice: An improvement on wake-mobile

name: DayKountdown
summary: "A simple date countdown app written for KDE Plasma, using Kirigami."

name: OptiImage
summary: An image optimizer based on optipng.
notice: WIP

name: Web Archives
summary: "A web archives reader"
description: "A web archives reader offering the ability to browse offline millions of articles from large community projects such as Wikipedia or Wikisource."
notice: Only supports ZIM files, but works pretty great!

name: Clapper
summary: "A GNOME media player build using GJS with GTK4 toolkit. The media player is using GStreamer as a media backend and renders everything via OpenGL."
notice: Preferences are not yet mobile friendly. Supports hardware accelerated playback (see more info and https://framagit.org/1peter10/flatpaks)

name: Keepassk
summary: "A password manager for KDBX password databases."
notice: WIP, read only, only for password-only encrypted databases currently.

name: FluffyChat
summary: "Chat with your friends"
description: "FluffyChat is a multi-platform Matrix client written in Dart/Flutter. It compiles to native code von Android, iOS, macOS, Windows and Linux and renders with Skia on the web."

name: Kasts
summary: "Kirigami-based podcast player"
description: "Kasts is a convergent podcast application."

name: Amazfish
summary: "Amazfish Bip support for SailfishOS"
notice: Companion app for smartwatches, including PineTime and Bangle.js. Originally for SailfishOS, has been ported to Kirigami.

name: Tinge
summary: "Tinge is a mobile first application for controlling Philips Hue lights on Linux"
notice: Could not test whether this actually works with Hue lights because I don't have any.

name: Hermes Messenger
summary: "Unofficial Fb Messenger app for linux smartphone"
description: "Hermes Messenger is a unofficial Gtk WebKit Facebook messenger app made for linux smartphone (eg: librem 5, pinephone). It's based on the Web version of Fb messenger with some hacks to run properly on a smartphone screen."
notice: Rewrite to GTK WebKit is in progress, check releases to download prebuilt packages.

name: Stream
summary: A YouTube client written in Python

name: Wike
summary: "Wikipedia Reader for the GNOME Desktop"
description: "Wike is a Wikipedia reader for the GNOME Desktop. Provides access to all the content of this online encyclopedia in a native application, with a simpler and distraction-free view of articles."
notice: Standard min-width is a bit too wide, scale-to-fit wike on fixes that.

name: SciTEQt
summary: "A port of the SciTE text editor to the Qt QML/Quick, which is optimized for touch devices."
notice: Does not come with a desktop file, has to be started manually with sciteqt from the terminal. Toggle mobile view via View - Mobile Platform UI.

name: Tok
summary: "KDE's convergent Telegram client."

name: Moonlander
summary: "Just another 'fancy' Gemini client."
notice: Alpha and sadly in maintenance mode, but runs well after scale-to-fit moonlander on.

name: Fossil
summary: "A simple GTK Gopher/Gemini client written in Vala"
notice: Runs fine after scale-to-fit. It's origin/the project it has been forked from, dragonstone, scales perfectly out of the box, so I recommend it over Fossil.

name: Readerview
summary: "A mobile-ready gpu-accelerated gemini browser."
notice: Part of the UI vanish when on Gemini sites, even with scale-to-fit applied. To build it, use a version of gmni before OpenSSL was replace with BearSSL.

name: alrisha
summary: "an experimental Qt/QML destkop browser for Gemini"
notice: No icon or launcher, a bit buggy, but it works!

name: Rocket
summary: "GTK Gemini browser"
description: "Rocket is a Gemini browser. Somewhat usable, albeit with missing or incomplete features."
notice: WIP, scales nicely.

name: Agregore Browser
summary: "A minimal browser for the distributed web"
notice: Build it as described on https://github.com/AgregoreWeb/agregore-browser/issues/103

name: GNOME Maps
summary: "Maps is a map application for GNOME."
description: "Maps gives you quick access to maps all across the world. It allows you to quickly find the place you’re looking for by searching for a city or street, or locate a place to meet a friend. Maps uses the collaborative OpenStreetMap database, made by hundreds of thousands of people across the globe."
notice: Scales fine, except for the navigation view.

name: Emulsion
summary: "Stock up on colors"
description: "Store your palettes in an easy way, and edit them if needed. "

name: Curtail
summary: "Simple & useful image compressor."
notice: Settings and preferences don't scale well.

name: Tokodon
summary: "Tokodon is a Mastodon client for Plasma and Plasma Mobile"
notice: WIP

name: Almond
summary: "The Almond Virtual Assistant, Linux desktop version"
description: "Almond is a virtual assistant that lets you interact with your services and accounts in natural language, with flexibility and privacy. Almond draws its power from the crowdsourced Thingpedia, an open collection of Web and Internet of Things APIs. Anyone can contribute support for the favorite service, with few lines of code and a handful of natural language sentences."

name: Pyrocast
summary: "Another podcast app for Linux phones (e.g., Pinephone)"
notice: WIP, buggy with a select feeds, no settings screen yet.

name: pods
summary: "Cross platform Podcast app targetting the pinephone specifically (in early development)"
notice: WIP, interface works once you get used to it. Window is not placed optimally in Phosh, hiding the title bar and showing a slice of the wallpaper.

name: GNOME Weather
summary: "Monitor the current weather conditions for your city, or anywhere in the world."
notice: Mobile compliant since version 40

name: SBB
summary: "A simple gtk app to get timetable information for swiss public transport."

name: Scrum Poker
summary: "A small gtk app to help estimate the effort for a task."

name: Pine Pass
summary: "GUI for password-store.org written with Python and GTK. Originally written for the PinePhone but should be compatible with most Linux distros."

name: Tangram
summary: "Run web apps on your desktop"
description: "Tangram is a new kind of browser. It is designed to organize and run your Web applications. Each tab is persistent and independent. You can set multiple tabs with different accounts for the same application."

name: Baconer
summary: "Kirigami/ QT Reddit Client"
notice: WIP, hard to rate: Fits the screen, but rendering of parts of the layout is bad on small screens and text disappears (see Screenshots).

name: Sol
summary: "A convergent web browser"
notice: WIP, still buggy. Also I am not sure about the license, the repo is inconclusive.

name: Image Roll
summary: "Image Roll - simple and fast GTK image viewer with basic image manipulation tools. Written in Rust."

name: OpenTodoList
summary: "A Todo List and Note Taking Application."
description: "OpenTodoList is a todo list and note taking application. Organize todo lists, notes and images in libraries, which can be stored either completely local on the device you are working on (and hence ensure no information leaks out to untrusted third parties) or use the built in synchronization features which allows you to synchronize your libraries across devices using your self-hosted NextCloud or ownCloud server (or other WebDAV servers). In addition, a library is just a directory holding the items of your library as simple files - this allows you to use any kind of third party synchronization tool (like DropBox) to sync your information."

name: Seahorse
summary: "A password and encryption key manager for GNOME."
description: "With seahorse you can create and manage PGP keys, create and manage SSH keys, publish and retrieve keys from key servers, cache your passphrase so you don’t have to keep typing it and backup your keys and keyring."
notice: Almost fits the screen perfectly with release 40, just the "Find Remote Keys" and the "Preferences" page don't work in portrait, but are fine in landscape.

name: Gnote
summary: "Gnote started as a C++ port of Tomboy and has moved its own path later."
description: "Gnote is a simple note-taking application for GNOME desktop environment. It allows you to capture your ideas, link them together using WikiWiki-style links, group together in notebooks and some extra features for everyday use."
notice: Scales well (reviewed release 40.1), only the settings menu does not fit the screen properly. But: Opening notes is tedious and requires the use of the enter key on the software keyboard.

name: postmarketOS Backup
summary: "A backup application that integrates with apk to quickly backup and restore your system state in postmarketOS"

name: Pinephone Compass
summary: "This is a proof of concept of a simple compass app for the Pine64 Pinephone."
description: "For the moment it only supports those hardware versions with the original LIS3MDL magnetometer chip (it was changed circa Q1 2021). The app is written in Python and interfaces with the magnetometer via its Linux Kernel driver. The graphical interface is currently a rudimentary implemetation using matplotlib's plotting capabilities."
notice: Works great after calibration!

name: LinMoTube
summary: "YouTube Client for Linux Mobile"
description: "Browse and play media from YouTube without the need to sign-in. With the recent popularity of Linux Phones and the desire to stream media from YouTube, LinMoTube was born! Supports both YouTube Video mode and YouTube Music mode with a convenient toggle switch!"

name: Phosh Look
summary: "Phosh look manages ~/.config/gtk-3.0 with preset themes"
notice: Hardcoded paths limit this app to PureOS or similar systems with a user named purism right now.

name: Vakzination
summary: "Vakzination manages your health certificates like vaccination, test, and recovery certificates."

name: Obfuscate
summary: "Censor private information."
description: "Obfuscate lets you redact your private information from any image."
notice: Scaling of the unnecessary Keyboard Shortcuts and About menus does not fit the screen, but imho is not bad enough to rate it down.

name: Gerbil
summary: "Gerbil is a minimal gemini-client for linux and linux-mobile"
description: "Gerbil is a little rodent. And also a little gemini browser, written with mobile linux in mind!"

name: Wasp Companion
summary: "Companion app for wasp-os"
description: "This is a Linux companion app for wasp-os, a smartwatch operating system. It's written in Python with GTK and Libhandy."
notice: WIP, did not work with my WaspOS PineTime in my short, limited-depth testing. Builds as a flatpak.

name: µPlayer
summary: "A simple GTK4 based video player for mobile phones"
description: "Minimalistic video player using GTK4 and GStreamer. The main purpose is to make playing hw accelerated videos with hantro and OpenGL simple."
notice: Provides accelerated video playback, also on PinePhone. Needs to be set as default app, as it lacks a dialog to open files.

name: Visual Voicemail
summary: "Visual Voicemail Player"
notice: Requires vvmd (https://gitlab.com/kop316/vvmd) to be set up and your cellular provider to support Visual Voicemail.

name: YOGA Image Optimizer
summary: "YOGA Image Optimizer is a graphical user interface for YOGA Image that converts and optimizes the size of JPEGs, PNGs and WebP image files."

name: dragonstone
summary: "A simple GTK Gopher/Gemini client written in Vala"
notice: Fossil is a fork of this project

name: OTPClient
summary: "Highly secure and easy to use OTP client written in C/GTK that supports both TOTP and HOTP"
description: "Highly secure and easy to use GTK+ software for two-factor authentication that supports both Time-based One-time Passwords (TOTP) and HMAC-Based One-Time Passwords (HOTP)."
notice: Supports importing from many other OTP apps.

name: KMixtapez
summary: "A Kirigami app for listening to mixtapes, albums & songs hosted on MyMixtapez dot com"

name: foKus
summary: "foKus is a To-do application, designed for Plasma Mobile using Kirigami framework."
description: "Fokus is a convergent task management app built using Kirigami and Qt frameworks. Fokus is mainly being built for plasma-mobile platform, but it can also be used on the desktop."
notice: WIP; still buggy

name: tvtoday
summary: "A application to inspect the television program of today. Made for the pinephone."
description: "This application is still in development, but should work. This application currently only supports TV SPIELFILM, but can be extended to work on any website serving similar content."
notice: WIP, works, limited to German TV currently, but adding other providers of tv information is documented at https://github.com/Schmiddiii/tvtoday/wiki/Creating-Providers

name: LaTre
summary: "Assistant tool for GNOME Contacts. Do import contacts from VCard files, delete contacts."
notice: Can be used to import vcard files. License according to https://github.com/hongquan/LaTre/blob/23d98b3011c2b1baec01ca61038c9c3822ffc389/debian/copyright.

name: modRana
summary: "ModRana is a flexible GPS navigation system for mobile devices."
notice: Great app, it really should be packaged in more distributions.To help with this, I created a PKGBUILD script that builds the current state from git: https://framagit.org/linmobapps/pkgbuilds/-/tree/main/modrana-git . Does not fit the screen after first launch for me, but toggling the upwards pointing arrow for full screen fixes this for me.

name: Satellite
summary: “Displays navigation satellite (GPS) information from ModemManager enabled devices”

name: Kalendar
summary: "A calendar application using Akonadi to sync with external services (NextCloud, GMail, ...) "
notice: WIP, but already pretty nice

name: Breathing
summary: "Relax, focus, and become stress-free."
description: "Breathing is a very simple application that guides your breathing pattern. This pattern is recommended by experts that will help ease your anxiety. It also provides a calming sound to make it much easier to relax."
notice: Scales perfectly since 0.1.1.

name: GNOME Screenshot
summary: "GNOME Screenshot is a small utility that takes a screenshot of the whole desktop; the currently focused window; or an area of the screen."
notice: Works for "Screen" capture area on Phosh 0.12.1 with release 40. Needs scale-to-fit.

name: Metronome
summary: "Practice music with a regular tempo"
description: "Metronome beats the rhythm for you, you simply need to tell it the required time signature and beats per minutes."

name: Telly Scout
summary: "Convergent EPG based on Kirigami."
notice: WIP - somewhat works, supports many european tv channels
